Our portfolio includes new independent houses in established societies and modern builder floors all designed with contemporary living in mind. Explore the popular rental types below to determine the best fit for your needs and start living the high-quality lifestyle Sector 90 promises.

faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About How to Rent House in Sector 90
faqSection.description: We address common questions prospective tenants have when exploring residential rental properties in Sector 90 Gurgaon ensuring clarity and confidence in your housing search process.

faqs.question: What is the typical rental price range for an independent house in Sector 90 Gurgaon
faqs.answer: The rental price for an independent house in Sector 90 varies significantly based on the size configuration and specific location within the sector. A standard 2 BHK builder floor might range from ₹15000 to ₹22000 per month while a spacious 3 BHK independent house or villa can command rent between ₹25000 and ₹45000 or even higher for premium fully furnished options. Prices also depend on the age of the construction and the amenities provided within the society.

faqs.question: Are independent houses or builder floors more common for rent in Sector 90
faqs.answer: Both independent houses and builder floors are widely available but builder floors tend to dominate the market particularly in the 2 BHK and 3 BHK configurations. Builder floors offer modern construction quality and usually come with dedicated parking and private access providing a good balance between apartment living and the space of an independent house. We maintain listings for both ensuring you have maximum choice.

faqs.question: What lease terms are standard when I Rent House in Sector 90 Gurgaon
faqs.answer: The most common lease term in Sector 90 is 11 months which is automatically renewable upon mutual agreement between the tenant and the landlord. Longer lease agreements such as 24 months are also possible especially for high-value properties but these terms require explicit negotiation and documentation at the outset of the rental agreement. Always clarify the lock-in period and notice period requirements.

faqs.question: Is Sector 90 a safe locality for families and working women renters
faqs.answer: Yes Sector 90 is widely considered a safe and well-organized locality especially within its numerous gated communities and licensed housing societies. These areas often feature robust security protocols including monitored entrances regular patrolling and reliable community management ensuring a secure environment for all residents particularly families and single working women. Street lighting and infrastructure are also modern and well-maintained.

faqs.question: What are the common additional charges besides the monthly rent in Sector 90
faqs.answer: Beyond the basic monthly rent tenants should anticipate standard charges like maintenance fees typically covering common area upkeep and security services. Utility bills such as electricity water and gas are usually paid separately based on consumption. Always confirm with your landlord if property tax or any specific society charges are included or excluded from the stated monthly rent amount.

faqs.question: How close is Sector 90 to major employment hubs like Cyber City
faqs.answer: Sector 90 offers excellent connectivity to major employment hubs. While it is located in New Gurgaon Cyber City is generally reachable within 40 to 50 minutes during peak traffic via NH 48. Furthermore Sector 90 is highly advantageous for those working in IMT Manesar or the industrial and commercial belts along the Dwarka Expressway ensuring a relatively shorter commute time compared to many other sectors.

faqs.question: Are houses for rent in Sector 90 usually furnished semi-furnished or unfurnished
faqs.answer: You will find a good mix of all three options but semi-furnished houses are the most prevalent. Semi-furnished typically means the house comes with essential fixtures like modular kitchen cabinets wardrobes air conditioning units and geysers. Fully furnished options are generally available in premium properties while unfurnished units are best for tenants who plan to stay long-term and wish to bring their own furniture and interior decor.

faqs.question: What documents are required to finalize a house rental agreement here
faqs.answer: To finalize your rental agreement you will typically need copies of your Aadhar Card and PAN Card for identity verification. Foreign nationals require passport and visa copies. Additionally you will need proof of employment or student status along with bank account details for security deposit transfer. A formal registered lease agreement will be drafted detailing all terms and conditions of the tenancy.

faqs.question: Is public transport readily available for residents renting in Sector 90 Gurgaon
faqs.answer: Yes public transport connectivity in Sector 90 is steadily improving. The sector is well-served by local auto-rickshaws and shared cabs. Furthermore connectivity to the upcoming metro line and frequent city bus services from nearby major junctions ensures residents have convenient access to the wider city network making daily commuting easy and accessible.

faqs.question: Can I negotiate the rent or the security deposit amount with the landlord in Sector 90
faqs.answer: Yes negotiation is always possible and encouraged in the Gurgaon rental market including Sector 90. The degree of negotiation depends on the current market demand the property's uniqueness and the duration of your proposed lease. Typically landlords require a security deposit equivalent to two months rent but this can sometimes be negotiated down to one month's rent for highly qualified tenants.
